Subjective: Hard stools for 3 months; bowel movements every 2-3 days, difficult to pass. Associated abdominal cramps and bloated feeling. Pain on pressing abdomen. Eats very little, low appetite (chronic), but no recent change in diet. Underweight, but stable (no recent weight loss). Tried olive oil with some effect. No blood in stool. Urination normal. Menses regular. Family Hx: Sister with ulcerative colitis (patient notes different symptoms). ICE: Wants to know if condition is serious and what can be done to soften stool.
Objective: Abdomen: Bloated appearance. Auscultation: Normal bowel sounds. Percussion: Varying tympani, dampening in lower left quadrant. Palpation: Soft. No pain in renal lodges, upper abdomen, or right lower quadrant. Tenderness noted in the left lower quadrant.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), constipation-predominant. No alarm symptoms.
Plan: 1. Prescribe Psyllium fibre sachets, take daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 2. Safety Net: Contact sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood appears in stool. 3. Follow-up: Re-evaluate in 6 weeks. 4. Future Plan: Discuss referral to a dietitian at next appointment.
